website_summaries.verdict: An acceptable option for extended outdoor time and for those who want rugged looks and lots of space. The tubing may occasionally require maintenance.
pros: In addition to its 2.5-liter bladder, owners rave about its spaciousness
it's capable of fitting ample provisions and survivalist tools
Handsome  camouflage design is ideal for serious outdoor enthusiasts
cons: Some issues w/leaks have been reported, but owners suggest checking the tubing connections
The design is a bit impractical for light use, and it may be too heavy for some users

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Beast tested. Approved.
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from Spartan Beast with this. I'd say it is very good for OCR. We spent 8 hours through 16 miles on the course, it provides enough water for me, and I have enough space to store my gel/snacks. Beast requires headlamp and glow sticks, and this pack can hold them without problem. It is on the other hand not so bulky with all the storage. Went though barbed wires with them on my back, not once they got stuck with the wires. They fit very well, not feeling any boucing/shaking while I ran. No chaffing of any kind. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great value, especially if you like tactical/modular equipment
customer_reviews.text: Pack looks and feels great. Webbing is solid (holds my molle Nalgene bottle bag well - pictured), zippers are smooth, and the included water reservoir has no leaks or issues with the hose/mouthpiece. I'm a big guy so I can't use the waist strap but the chest strap fits, if a bit snug (56-58" chest). After-sale support from the seller has been great and I can tell they truly care about their products and customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: I love the size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hydration backpack for summer mountain biking. I went out biking three time this week with this backpack already. My mountain biking friends saw it and asked me where I got it at. I love the size; very compact and light. It fits my mini bike pump, small tools, tube, snack bars, wallet, and key. I also have Camelbak too. I can say this backpack quality is as good as Camelbak. I am very pleased with my purchase of this backpack. I recommend to all bikers and hikers.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Han

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Leaky. I filled the bladder to take it on a hike, and by the time I got my keys there was water dripping out the bottom of my pack. The weld around the hydration tube connector at the bottom off the bag had severe leaks. I wasn't too worried, as the owner of the company had sent me several emails asking for a good review and promising to fix any problems I might have with the product.Unfortunately, two weeks later, I am STILL waiting to hear back. The back pack is of decent quality, so I bought a new bladder at my local sporting goods store and have had no other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph k. Bug

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Poor construction, broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: The pack I received was just bad construction. 2nd day of wearing: water bladder is leaking everywhere from the point of attachment to the hose. It is sealed, I triple checked and made sure it was in tight and Korbut was missing. Nope, just leaked. Right shoulder strap pulled off the bag itself- stitching was apparently just half assed and poorly done. Now I have a leaky bag that can only hang from my left shoulder, and because it was an Xmas purchase for a family member, I’m outside the return window and SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete and utter failure .
customer_reviews.text: Missing all the zipper pulls on arrival. Made my own out of 550. Bladder has defective seal and I can already tell where it is going to fail. 1 shoulder strap failed where it connects to the bottom of the bag and the other one is starting to fail. I have only had this for 2 days. This thing is a pile of hot garbage and I am waiting on support to reply before returning to Amazon. I weighed it and it is just shy of 10 pounds with the stuff I had and the bladder full. I am pretty sure a Walmart bag is more durable than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product / customer experience IMHO
customer_reviews.text: Used it for running (distances between 3 and 10 miles, about ~15 times so far). Backpack is nice and secure on your back and you don't have to worry about it jiggling all over the place. Hydration bladder probably has closer to a 2.0L capacity, since you have to fill it up until it doesn't spill, and the screw-on cap limits the amount of water you can fill without it overflowing. The cap for the mouthpiece broke off yesterday, so the plastic / connection quality could use improvement, and the mouthpiece is leaky, but otherwise everything works as intended. I messaged Frank from customer service about it and he said he will send me a new hydration bladder this week.
customer_reviews.author: Ying Wang

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to fill up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camelbak for a week long trip to a desert. It was easy to fill up, small enough for my things and worked great. Surprisingly I had a few nice comments on the color and on the amount of things I can pack. The cap on the tip of the mouthpiece had fallen off by the end of the trip, but it wasn't really needed. I wish I had gotten a camelbak for earlier hiking trips, but it's great to start with this one! I would absolutely recommend this to friends and family. Side note: One of my favorite features on this product is that it has a whistle incorporated into the front chest buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Whittsl

customer_reviews.title: Toxic plastic taste after washing 3 times.
customer_reviews.text: I've washed mine and rinsed it three times. Tasted the water just after filling it after the third wash and the plastic taste was minimal enough that I decided to stop trying to wash it. However once I tried to drink from it during my hike about an hour later, I nearly barfed, it tasted like I was drinking a liquified air mattress. Very toxic taste, not going to try to drink out of this again, since I don't think I'd like cancer that much.
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Frank kinda sucks
customer_reviews.text: Love the carrier but the bladder was defective. It leaked water and the seller unigear or frank never contacted me back about it. I bought a replacement which actually works. So giving it a one star since it was bad customer service. They emailed me saying they care but actions speak louder than words be carful of the bladder if you buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Juan M Martinez

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY Received on Saturday and assembled on Sunday, filled with water Monday morning. Lasted exactly 2 hours on-site this morning and started leaking. LEAKS like mad from the On/Off valve. Quick Start guide was NO HELP From what I can tell on the other connections, the O-Rings are UNDER-SIZED (too small) to seal correctly.
customer_reviews.author: James B Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: Top Ranked Product for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration pack. So far I've used it twice. Once for a leisurely hike on the Florida Trail for a few miles and the second time for a Spartan Super race in Daytona. It worked perfectly for both of those. I was able to put some snacks in the zipper section to eat during the race and they certainly came in handy. My only issue is that the dust cover and mouthpiece fell off at some point in time during the race. It was still easy to drink out of because I could just flip the valve open and drink and then close it when I was done. Hopefully I can find a replacement dust cover soon.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, one came broken.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I have ordered two of these packs and one of them is broken. I have had no luck contacting customer support as I keep getting spam emails from them but no responses to my problem. Great item over all with good storage space and seems durable. However, the mouthpiece comes apart rater easily when trying to open the cap, and the chest strap can only pull so far because of the elastic band feature in it. For many it will be perfectly fine. In addition, the waist strap is a bit small, as I am not the smallest guy, it fits where my pants do, but not on the true waist around the belly button.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Looks Cool AF, but cargo space is TINY!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a hydration pack with a couple SMALL pockets, this is great. Looks cool, nice materials. BUT -if you want to store anything more than a wallet, sunglasses, and a sandwich, THINK AGAIN! The cargo space is tiny on this thing -and it's split into two SEPARATE compartments making it even less useful... Again, it looks very cool and the mesh padding is nice on the back -but most of what you're carrying is BACKPACK -not CARGO! LOL....
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration back pack with some room for extras
customer_reviews.text: We've been really pleased with the backpack. With two securing straps, the weight from the water is non-existent. The cut-off switch prevents drippage (which is a common problem with hydration packs) and the mouth piece seems well-fitted and well-made. I had some discomfort on my right arm when wearing the backpack shirtless, but after tightening the top support strap- it was much more comfortable. With option, storage and a creative design-this is a great overall product.
customer_reviews.author: ck17

customer_reviews.title: Great pack but hose leaks at connection.
customer_reviews.text: I was not going to leave a negative review, but I left a message with the company and have not heard anything back. I simply wanted them to replace the hose that plugs into the water bladder the bag is wonderful the water bladder is great but the connection there the O-ring or something is no good. I took the hose from another water bladder that I had from a different manufacturer and plugged it in and it worked fine. I simply wanted them to replace the hose but I have gotten no reply. I would gladly change this review if they make good on this but I have yet to hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great pack.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Took it on a five mile hike to try it out when I got it. Followed the instructions on cleaning the water bottle and had no problem with funny taste. Weighted just around 12 pounds with a full water tank some food, small compact 9mm and survival gear in the bottom pocket. Also a 6x9 first aid kit and a buck knife attached to the molle on the outside. Seemed fine with all that. Look forward to trying it out on the trip to the Rockies this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly better than imagined
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I got this thinking I could get just a basic replacement to my hydration pack that I had bought from a friend with a leaky nozzle. Not only does this come with a better nozzle, it has a close gasket, and is more pressure focused instead of a direct stream due to the nozzle-head type. It has TONS of pockets for storage which is delightful, but can fold in half for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Giusti

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great hydration pack overall! I'd recommend it. Pros: * Construction quality of the pack is very good. * The hydration bladder and drinking hose seem good enough. I washed them thoroughly a couple of times, and don't notice any chemical flavors. * Half the price of the comparable CamelBak Ambush! Cons: * MOLLE webbing is not to spec. The horizontal spacing of the stitching is too wide, and the vertical spacing is inconsistent. It works for the attachments I need, but won't work with everything. * Trying to find replacement parts for the bladder and hose will be impossible since it's unbranded. If they wear out, I'll probably buy a CamelBak bladder system and still come out ahead on price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Keller

customer_reviews.title: Quality material
customer_reviews.text: So I haven’t actually used it yet but it is clearly quality made. I cleaned out the bladder and straw with lemon juice and that took care of the chemically smell and taste. I’ve been running distance and needed something compact I could throw my phone keys and EDC into and have the added benefit of hydration. This fits nicely and is completely adjustable. I will update after some use, but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for people with a short torso.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the bag but unfortunately I had to return it. My husband bought it for me so I could use it for Tough Mudder and Spartan races. The reason I had to return it is because it was too long for my torso. I am 5'2" and after adjusting all the straps, I buckled the waist strap to find out the bag wouldn't lay flat. If the bottom compartment was detachable it would have fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Tags

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get the straw to work properly
customer_reviews.text: Backpack feels ok in durability I will update later on how many uses I get out of it. It’s really hard to get water through the straw first time using I got a headache from sucking so hard and getting air bubbles. I’ve tried everything checked everything can’t seem to get the straw to work properly. I’m 6’3 271 pounds size jeans 40-32 and the backpack fits a little snug but does fit with straps out to the max. I use the pack for 3-6 miles jogs/runs.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pack for me
customer_reviews.text: I use this pack for hiking and its awesome! Water capacity is large enough to last me for 3-4 hour hikes in a very high, dry climate, and I drink a lot. Storage capacity is sufficient for snacks, survival knife, first aid supplies, etc. The pack is light and has a small footprint so its easy to wear and it doesn't rub or chafe me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1000

customer_reviews.title: For tactical raving in the dark
customer_reviews.text: In the night hours between dusk and dawn, my significant other and I had tactically attended a music event. As we tactically infiltrated the compound in which it was held, we tactically filled it with the liquid form of 2 hydrogen molecues and one oxygen molecue for sustinance. This tactical hydration pack had saved us the trouble of carrying plastic containers of the same substance from previous tactical excursions and made our endeavors tactically more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Lousy seal
customer_reviews.text: First time to order a non-name-brand product. Was pretty impressed with the quality of the bag. The bladder appeared to be a good design but ruptured the first time I used it and spilled water all over my back and my kit. Looks like the seal around the base is a very weak point. Hopefully they have good customer service. I’ve used it once. Hopefully this is just an anomaly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This pack is great for commuting to and from work
customer_reviews.text: This pack is great for commuting to and from work. My run is 7.1 miles and it cinches up well with no flopping issues. The storage space is great for my phone, wallet, and a small Tupperware for my lunch (cleaned out). I added two pouches to the back to bring toiletries and a change of under clothes (shirt, socks, and underwear). It's a great backpack and the Velcro works well with my patches. The black color also falls in regulations for military use. What I don't care for, though, is the 90 degree bend in the spout. It's better straight.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Papp

customer_reviews.title: Unigear Tactical Hydration Pack Backpack 900D
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in good condition. I take this hydration pack mountain biking and has held up well. I can carry extra tools, snacks and a raincoat (raincoat is folded thin and slipped behind the flap opening where the hydration pouch goes in, it is zippered on both sides). It is a great product overall and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jups

customer_reviews.title: mouthpiece wasnt cut enough
customer_reviews.text: tried all the tricks listed on the internet to get the opening supple enough to get water out of it, I ended up using an exacto to slice the hole a bit more, other than this minor issue I love it., I have a 50" chest and a belly, the pack fits me perfectly with room for adjustment, it is comfortable to where I dont even realize its on me, it is constructed with good materials, the chem taste went away after I rinsed it and let it dry out.
customer_reviews.author: American shopper.

customer_reviews.title: OK except for most critical part
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this water pack is the mouthpiece that lets in more air than water. The mouthpiece can be disassembled which is the problem. It never seats properly and lets in air. I pulled off the mouthpiece and suck directly from the tube but you shouldn't have to do that. I would return but I cut off the lower straps which are not needed. I assumed the mouthpiece would work.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, very efficient,  life savor
customer_reviews.text: Overall a solid quality back pack and bladder. The buckle by bladder pocket is a bit confusing to use. The other buckle on the outside is nice and fits a towel well. Outside elastic works great for bike pump. Im able to fit a bluetooth speaker, phone, wallet, extra water bottle and keys in the pouches. The mouthpiece on nozzle is a little hard to get use to and doesnt turn the way i need it to while i am drinking from it. For the price you cant beat it. Just wish it came with a velcro patch to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Pleasurewayking22

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: though I really did like the bag, there was on design flaw that really ruined the experience for me. The placement of the water hose trap is so that it will scratch and bruise your arm while you were the bag. At first i thought this was fine as it seemed to be just an annoyance but after wearing the bag for the 3 days i had it on, my arm was cut to pieces and extremely irritated. I had to rap cloth around that section of the back to reduce the damage it inflicted on my body. The water bag is superb though
customer_reviews.author: smiri

customer_reviews.title: Gonna buy a few more at this price!
customer_reviews.text: My new go-to. I have used this pack for the last couple of weeks while mountain biking and I have 0 complaints. Stays tight to my back and doesn't move around much at all. Gives me room to carry other stuff as well like a multi tool on the molle. For 1/3 the price of some of my other smaller packs
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Bomd dot com
customer_reviews.text: I was iffy about buying this since it was on the cheap side but im glad I did. I have my ifak attached to the back of it and its pretty awesome. I love the storage on this thing. I am able to store quite a bit. I use it for running, hiking and military drills. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Second time's a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Great product when you are sent a complete item. First one shipped leaked terribly- beyond the bounds of reasonable when using the (poorly) translated troubleshooting instructions included in the box. Got on with Amazon customer service and they immediately dispatched another one and processed a return of the defective item. Compared the two before returning the bad one and discovered that the hose was missing a very important o-ring to prevent the Vesuvius-like water eruptions from the connection point. Problem solved and the new one works quite nicely. One star deduction for the substandard quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bag leaked water
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely disappointed with this item. I Bought it to go mountain biking. I even ordered it a week in advance to make sure everything worked. I checked and at first glanced, it appeared to work. But when the day of the ride came. The second I actually connected the straw, the bag started leaking. I must admit the actual bag looks pretty cool. I’m just disappointed this didn’t work as advertised. In the picture you can actually see a bubble forming from where the water is coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Efren

customer_reviews.title: Great for a day hike.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this set up. The storage pockets on the back could fit a few items like a packable poncho or rain coat, several granola bars, and other similarly sized items. The molle straps on the back would allow even more storage with the addition of a small molle pack. It's comfortable to wear. The d rings on the front would be a good place to clip on a gps. The quality overall looks good. This a major upgrade over the one the Army issued me back in 2008. I hope this one holds up as longs as the last one did.
customer_reviews.author: A. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Not super impressed
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not sure why there are soooo many amazing reviews on this. The bladder is super hard to close I always have to have someone help me with it. Also the mouth piece comes off a lot. Bought this is 2018 so maybe it’s just because I’ve had it long enough to notice these things.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for day hikes and training
customer_reviews.text: If you want a water pack that is comfortable and utilitarian, look no further! The fit is fully adjustable and comfortable. There is plenty of storage room. The water bladder is durable and well made. As is the mouth piece, with two different valves to prevent any leakage. When hiking and training in the desert, as I often do, this pack has become my best friend. I'm able to fit my knife, phone and an extra battery pack, headlamp, and lunch all in the same small pack. Perfect for hiking light.
customer_reviews.author: Easton

customer_reviews.title: The inside pouch is practically useless. The only two pouches that are usable are ...
customer_reviews.text: The stitching came undone on the shoulder strap at the bottom. So I was only able to wear it with one shoulder strap....until it broke too. The inside pouch is practically useless. The only two pouches that are usable are the two outside pouches and they aren't very large. I thought this was a Camelbak backpack. My previous one last about 15 years. This lasted less than a few months. I just didn't have time to request a refund. I just threw it the trash. If you need a hydration pack, spend the money and get a reputable product. This is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water bladder broke first time I filled it.
customer_reviews.text: The bag seems well made, but the water bladder broke the first time I used it. Then, when I managed to snap it back into place, it was almost impossible to drink water out of the hose. Absolutely horrible.
customer_reviews.author: ElBluf

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product - great price! Couldn’t ask for more!
customer_reviews.text: I love how much space this bag has. My CamelBak has almost the same size bladder but not NEARLY as much space. I was looking for more storage room to have a safe place to put: phone, keys, wallet, sun screen, snacks, and glasses and this bag has all the space I need! I wouldn’t necessarily consider it “lightweight” as I fill it to the brim but it’s my new preferred bag for hiking. Added bonuses: when you register your product, you get a free gift AND the bladder stays cold really really well!!!
customer_reviews.author: Madison Tillery

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: Nice pack, just what I was looking for. It has a chest strap and waist strap to keep it from moving around a lot and the straps have little hold downs so they aren't flapping in the breeze. Lat pads and lumbar pad are a nice addition. Internal mesh pockets and lots of places to hook things onto such and climbing gear, carabiners and such. A well made, well thought through design.The bladder, hose, valve, and mouth-piece are leak free and function properly. Zippers and stitching have no problems. I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. White

customer_reviews.title: Good pack for hiking to stay hydrated.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it a couple times on long hikes and runs. It’s exactly what I wanted and works well for the most part. When hiking or running in the hot sun the drinking tube gets really warm so the first bit of water is warm until the water from the bladder starts coming through. Otherwise the water in the bladder stayed cold for over 4 hours. The pack is comfortable and I was glad to have it on some of my longer runs and hikes. The pack held some snacks, my phone and charger, and other things I needed. Only downside was the tube for drinking gets hot in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I must say I am very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to decide which camelbak to buy. I must say I am very pleased with my purchase! I went on a hike the same day my package arrived! I love the fact that it has a place to attach a Velcro patch. I bought a patch that honors firefighters and emt/paramedics. I am an EMT. I also love how the material feels very durable and high quality. I would also like to thank Frank for reaching out to me and making sure my package has arrived! Really shows a lot about this company! THANKS AGAIN!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, I was very excited to receive the product. Before putting the items together. I wash the water bag. Mind you it was very easy to attach. Now, I wear a hydration pack almost every day. It became my partner in crime. I will not leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiara James

customer_reviews.title: One unit leaked
customer_reviews.text: The backpacks were as described and good quality. The bladders and attachments were clean and ready to use. My 2 boys used these for a weekend encampment with CAP. When we cleaned and prepped for the weekend one bladder leaked and we could not get the attachments (the attachment from the hose to the bladder) to seal correctly and it leaked all weekend. I contacted Unigear and sent pictures of a difference between the two units and they sent out a replacement immediately. The replacement was clean and when tested it did not leak. I would definitely use this company again. The product was as advertised, the quality of materials were high quality and the service was impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Schoolcraft

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain
customer_reviews.text: So far , so good. It arrived in good time and was well packaged. The lighter color was more of a tan/kacky and the grey was a bit more green that the images provided, but that suits me fine. Holds water and no issues yet. will update the score to a 5 if it holds up after a month or two of use. There were a few random loose thread here and there, but no seams were compromised. Just hit a few with a lighter. Has good adjustment and fits well. I am 6 foot 245lbs and it seems to stay in place with room for adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: G-Tech

customer_reviews.title: What a great Backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This hydrogen pack is great for what i need. I just got in to MTB and i really need something to keep me hydrated on my long rides. The 2.5L pack is great, it hold enough water for a 2 hour MTB track. The storage is good enough for emergency stuff and some tools. I would recommend this for anyone that need a small pack with a great size hydrogen pack.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for rugged day use.
customer_reviews.text: Removed the included bladder and replaced with a camelbak antidote 100 oz reservoir - fits perfect. It looks to also fit bladders with smaller fill opening. Heavy duty cordura fabric. Padded back. Padded adjustable shoulder straps, fit perfect for 6'2" male. Not bulky. Better straps than camelbak tactical hydration pack. Top compartment held googles/sunglasses, small sunscreen, small flashlight, lighter, hand sanitizer, ID. Lower zip pocket held battery pack, hand wipes, maps and depending on time of day: large sunscreen, hat or extra base layer/shirt. Easy to fill with water. Fastex buckle on back clipped cup or small towel or windbreaker. Elastic tie points on back are easy to clip lighting.
customer_reviews.author: kwerks

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This pack is a great product for daily hiking, as well as when stuck on a long guard shift. The pockets are perfect for a small personal medical kit and few personal or survival items. A quick rinse with soda water (as suggested) left no plastic or rubbery taste. It did take a couple of tries to get used to the bite grip drinking hose, but once mastered delivers a steady stream of refreshing water without a great amount of effort.The 2.5L capacity is more than enough to get through a day of hiking. All this at a very reasonable price. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Little Small But Will Make It Work
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is a little on the small side. I was barely able to fit a first aid kit and some sunscreen into the lower pocket and so I'm not totally sure how I'll fit some food and a jacket into the pack but I think I can work something out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Taft

customer_reviews.title: The carrying case is made of strong, durable material ...
customer_reviews.text: The carrying case is made of strong, durable material which has integrated MOLLE (pronounced MOLLY) straps for any military style gear you may have in your possession. There is only one concern, the tube became bent either during manufacturing, or, shipment, and it made for a difficult time retrieving water from the reservoir. Gently warming the tube and inserting a tube to force the kinks out seemed to rectify the situation. Overall, five star rating and I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Never a Dry Moment!
customer_reviews.text: I used my pack while coaching football. It gives me the opportunity to stay hydrated throughout practice without having to grab a bottle during breaks. It's also a more hygienic option. I also like the ability to store my cellphone and keys in the pouch versus keeping them in my pockets or leaving them in my car. My only complaint is the waist belt. I'm a 290lb guy and can't use the waist belt because it's too short. Outside of that, a great purchase and very useful product. I'd recommend to anyone that will be working outside cutting grass, biking, hiking, walking, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Crvrtgr85

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing pack!  THIS IS A MUST BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing pack! THIS IS A MUST BUY!!! We recently went to Disney and have never owned a hydro pack before. After receiving this is the mail my first impression was very good, the pack is built solid and and molly is solid as well.. One of my other concerns was, how long would the water stay cool?! To my surprise we walked all day in the heat (10am-6pm) and the water NEVER got hot.... It wasn't Ice cold, but it wasn't hot! So happy with this purchase, it saved us :)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony & Liz

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Used this for our trip to Colorado and it was great. Don’t use it often so it held up great for what we needed. Not sure that would be the case if it was used frequently though. Had some issues with the mouth piece
customer_reviews.author: Visha Anevich

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this backpack! It's small and lightweight, yet there is plenty of storage space for everything I need. It seems to be very well constructed and durable, and the overall quality exceeded my expectations considering the cost of it. It's easily just as good, if not better, than packs costing twice as much -- or more. Great value, can't go wrong, would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Root

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This pack looks and feels very high quality! It even has padding on the back. I'm looking forward to getting great use out of this entire setup. It does seem like it'll be easy to clean and/or replace parts or all of the hydration system, which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty good. It’s been to big bend National Park ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty good. It’s been to big bend National Park in Texas and survived a week doing Harvey Relief in houston. It’s been boating all over the chesapeak and has walked the streets in Boston and NYC. Top flap is tearing on the inside so stuff now falls out. I have to sew it up. It’s a good day pack for the money but higher quality bags are out there. I’ve had this bag for 6 months at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Ebeling

customer_reviews.title: Solid water source for MOST 3/4 hour trips
customer_reviews.text: Took this water pack to southern Spain for a few weeks. Changed out the pack for the tan looking version so it wouldnt trap as much heat. Beside any learning curve with its functionality the only thing negative (almost making me want to 3 star it) was the taste. I washed this thing SO many times... dried... etc. before I even used it and like everything of this nature it still has that 'taste'. However, when it was fresh and cold you couldnt tell.
customer_reviews.author: daniel derubis sr.

customer_reviews.title: I love the waist and chest straps
customer_reviews.text: This pack has been serving me fantastically for my forest service job. I have not had any problems with the bladder or pack whatsoever. I manage to fit a lunch in the pockets, with a small icepack in the bottom pocket and a larger ice pack slipped in the bladder compartment. Cold lunch and cold water! I still don't know what the brown button next to the on/off switch for the hose is though. I love the waist and chest straps, it fits comfortably on me and allows for good mobility. I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Bigger then expected
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend has a camelback that’s smaller and more expensive. This ones perfect! Can fit a lot of snacks and must haves for hiking. I’ve been looking at it for months and I’m super happy I finally bought it
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this backpack. Perfect amount of space for simple things. Super comfortable and it looks awesome! I got the camo print and proudly displayed my MAGA patch on the Velcro strip!
customer_reviews.author: Deeners

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Lots of storage and function. A friend of mine had actually offered me a camelback 1.5 liter hydration pack for free. I am a fairly large man so the camelback to me look more like a shoulder pad than a hydration pack. It did not look right at all so I ordered this pack. Its definately a better fit and I love the extra storage space. I carry my wallet, phone, pepper spray, keys, protein bars, selfie stick, small tripod, bicycle tube and tools in here with no prob.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: The first time we filled it with water and sealed it off everything was fine. But after that it never reopened
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy this did not work out! We took it on a camping/hiking weekend. The first time we filled it with water and sealed it off everything was fine. But after that it never reopened. We were stuck on a 7 mile hike carrying bottles because the bladder locked up. $40 waste. Hopefully others don’t have the same outcome as we did. The backpack itself is why we were interested in this product. We liked the look and compartment space and added cushions for your back. David said it was comfortable. Suppose we could buy another bladder to insert but expected better quality with only 1 use and the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use it for work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use while I'm working. I work in a warehouse that has no air conditioning in South Georgia. It works as I expected. I fill it with ice and cold water and it usually lasts my whole 8- hour shift. It is lightweight and the water stays cold. The wide opening makes it easy to fill and clean. The only issue I have had is the cap for the mouthpiece does not stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Billie C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Spartan Beast or Long Hikes.
customer_reviews.text: I order two of these, one for my husband and myself. We wore them while doing the Spartan Beast and also during long hikes in the mountains. They hold a lot of water and have plenty of room in the zipper pockets. The reason I am not giving it a 5 star is because she plastic parts on the shoulder strap that hold the mouthpiece in place, snapped and broke the first time my husband attempted to use it. Sucks because it was brand-new and shouldn't have broke like it did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the quality of the material is good. I've taken it on (2) 10 mile runs
customer_reviews.text: I've finally been able to train with this piece of gear. First, the quality of the material is good. I've taken it on (2) 10 mile runs. Its held up very well. I am a very tall person and have wide shoulders. My only issue is that the water tube kinks on my shoulder, so I have to lift my pack a bit to get the flow going. I like the pouches and the ability to carry little stuff with you on a long run or hike.
customer_reviews.author: CafeDu3

customer_reviews.title: Great sized pack
customer_reviews.text: The pack is a perfect compact sized hydration setup. The pack has limited storage, which is good for carrying the essentials. A larger pack would just mean extra weight. The insulated straw keeps drinks cool.
customer_reviews.author: oceanexplorer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I use this for hiking around the mountain trails. There’s enough water for me to manage a good 10 mile trek and enough space for extra bits like my phone and snacks. Way better quality than one would expect at this price.
customer_reviews.author: David_M

customer_reviews.title: It's just perfect. I filled the bladder and all the nozzles ...
customer_reviews.text: It's just perfect. I filled the bladder and all the nozzles worked perfectly. I thought it might be annoying to wear a water pack, but this was great! Plus, I really like all the small pockets to hold my gear. I've been looking for years for something just like this. Excellent! Highly recommend if your looking for a small pack with hydration. Bring on the hiking , I'm ready!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Strong plastic taste and the seam split. No good
customer_reviews.text: Every time I bite it to get water it like separates water starts flowing in and when you're done and you let go your lips get caught. VERY VERY STRONG plastic taste I washed it for early 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: Marco R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived and I've been slinging it up and down mountains and it has been doing great! The one and only thing I've noticed is that the dust cap on the hydration mouthpiece isn't very snug and falls open fairly easily but I'm sure I can find a fix for that. It is an excellent product and I appreciate the little touches like the whistle on the chest strap and the on/off valve that keeps the mouthpiece from leaking. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, can keep water cold or fresh for a few hours even when it is not completely insulated. Overall, the backpack is very comfortable. I use it with my motorcycle, pockets in the backpack are only two but good enough to store some tools and/or anything else. Unigear Customer support is great, I had some questions about the item and always received prompt replies. Overall a great customer experience.
customer_reviews.author: Emilesp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Hiking & Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Been amusing this pack for about 3 years and it is amazing! I never been disappointed and has never disappointed me. At first it does give off this plastic taste but after a couple good washes in warm water, smell and taste goes away completely. Sturdy material on the outside. Perfect for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Abryana J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is great value for money. As a beginner, I was not keen on splurging on the big brands till I was sure I would like regular hiking. Turns out this bag gives the big brands a good run for their money. There are two easy to use pouches. This coupled with the straightforward bladder design makes this my ready companion for the weekends
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This hydration back is awesome. It feels great on and it feels durable
customer_reviews.text: This hydration back is awesome. It feels great on and it feels durable. The bladder also feels durable and I really like that the tube is insulated and the bladder is BPA free. It is easy to stick your hand in the bladder with paper towels to dry. My only issue is sometimes it is a little bit of a pain to unscrew the tub from the bladder when cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, I bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad for his birthday! It's small so it's not really for carrying a bunch of items, however if you had a few clips you could clip things to the front. This seems pretty durable. However screwing the hose on the bladder is a little annoying, make sure you screw it on tight or it will leak ever where. I had this issue and a guy at work had to fix it for me. But after I have it to my dad I had to order one for myself. I even bought an extra bladder thinking this one would suck, but I didn't have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I bought this about two years ago and really have enjoyed it overall
customer_reviews.text: I was actually trying to ask a question about the product but for some reason, it would not let me. I bought this about two years ago and really have enjoyed it overall. However, recently the bladder has started to lead at the place where the hose integrates with it. I was curious if this is the normal lifespan of the bladder or if it should last longer. If you can answer me let me know. The three-star rating is because I felt this should last longer, but was curious what other people thought.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Baldizon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Performing Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present for my nephew and I didn’t want him to have something everyone else had so I looked away from the major brand leader in hydration backpacks and found this and it has exceeded expectations. Looks tough, as if it could be used by our military and has great color options.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality Backpack, very sturdy straps and clips. I'm a bigger guy and feels very comfortable even after using the 2 additional straps across chest/stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile. Great storage. Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Though the terrain wasn’t too touch, the pack held up great. When comparing it to my friends’ hydration pack, theirs lack the cap and tube insulation....and there’s are more expensive! I sincerely hope that I’ll get good mileage off this piece of equipment and that it won’t fail me when I’m deep in the hills. A+ so far. Would definitely recommend. Edit: April 4, 2018 My pack severed at the lower hip joint. I simply emailed customer support, and I received a replacement pack free of charge. These guys stand behind their product and I couldn't recommend it enough. Why would you spent $120 on a camelbak when this guy does it all for 1/3 the price?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great MTB Tactical hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: The design is perfect for my mountain bike use. The storage is perfect for my trail ride tools. I love the many little zipper pockets to hold my stuff. This is definitely a MTB grade pack. The bladder construction seems durable so far. I am very happy with the purchase. I really like the tactical look for sure.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBoo24

customer_reviews.title: Let down
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to use this when it arrived just in time the night before a work day in 107F heat. During the initial cleaning with warm soapy water the bladder failed after sitting for 10 minutes on my counter. The pack is awesome but the goal is to have ice water on the go. Can’t do that now. Replacement kit is $20. 2/3 the cost of the item wasted out of the gate. I almost bought a camelbak before I saw this. Maybe I should have stuck with that.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for MTB
customer_reviews.text: This pack really blew my expectations out of the water. Lots of little pro features I wasn't expecting to get for the price point. Good quality material, lots of storage and pockets, hose dispatches from the bladder for easy cleaning/drying, hose clips well on strap so stays out of the way while riding my bike, and on top of it all it was comfy. Took it on a 10 mile MTB ride and very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: Great Versatile Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for day trip hiking and also trail running. I was looking for something cost effective, as I have owned many Camelback products in the past that can be pretty spendy. To be honest this backpack has many of the technologies a camelback bag has and for the price it's a hell of a deal. I would highly recommend picking one up.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Failla

customer_reviews.title: Go Get One Now!
customer_reviews.text: First thing first, I ordered this product and got it the next day somehow! So I can definitely say that this seller is awesome! The product itself is really cool too! I think this is the ideal hydration pack for hiking. It has plenty of room for anything you would really need to bring. The hydration part of it alone comes with a really nice dust cover and it also rotates a full 360 degrees making it very simple to use. I would personally use this as any Backpack unless I need to carry bigger things. Go get one especial for the awesome price of only $40.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Krieger

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! The hydration pack is built sturdy and I love all the compartments it has. This is after having to return another bag that was cheaply made so this was satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Rector

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to the Spartan Beast races, what else do you need to know???
customer_reviews.text: This pack worked out perfectly for OCR courses. I bought it for a 13 mile Spartan Beast race, I refilled it twice and it had more than enough space to fit all my snacks and suppliments. The pack did not bounce too much during running and held up great through various levels of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Hose and bladder sucks
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is okay. Honestly a traditional backpack style would have suited me better. But the 3 stars is due to the bladder. The hose leaks constantly and the entire time I’m drinking water I’m getting just as much air as water. Where the hose leaks I’m assuming let’s air in while drinking. Very hard to get water out because of the leak.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolas

customer_reviews.title: Bag is Great, Loss of Star for bladder control
customer_reviews.text: I love the MOLLE system on the bag and the internal pockets. I did however have higher expectations of the bladder and have removed one star from my review because it took a seam leak upon filling in the parking lot prior to it's first outing. I've gone ahead and ordered a higher quality bladder and also a roll of duct tape for next time!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Egolf

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding hydration pack!!!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding hydration pack!! The pack has ample storage for your biking accessories. I was able to pack my wallet, keys, and sub compact pistol and still have room. As to the "plastic taste", just follow the instructions that come with the pack on filling it with soda water prior to use ( I did it for 1 hour) and you will eliminate the "plastic taste" in your water. Used it today on a long bike ride and worked great! Thank you for an outstanding and affordable product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Lots of storage. No leaks as some of the other reviews have stated. Tried the lemon and baking soda to get plastic taste out worked some what OK.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Good quality works as described
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to get set up not the lightest but has more storage than overage. Like all camel backs it is a pain to clean if you put anything in it but straight water. Good quality exactly what I ordered and delivered quicky cannot beat prime shipping !!!
customer_reviews.author: Sir william

customer_reviews.title: Best hydration bladder for the price
customer_reviews.text: Dont let the price fool you, this is a very high quality bladder for the price. I use this for hiking and biking, highly recommended. The day pack that holds it is also very high quality for the price. no cheap material or cheap zippers/buckles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inspect it as soon as you get it
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this hydration system and received it 4 days ago, I stupidly didn't unpack it until tonight to get it ready for tomorrow's 6 hour class in 105° heat... the side of the bladder has about a 1 cm area where the side is not sealed. The water just pours out, completely useless... we'll see how customer service is, but as of now, I'm completely unimpressed and will probably have a heat stroke tomorrow. yay!
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I mean before Bonnaroo last year I looked up best rated hydration packs and this is what I got. Let me tell you it deserves that rating! I’ve had a bunch of packs before and every single one leaked and the water got hot. This one stayed cool through out the day and it was 100 degree in Tennessee! It never once leaked at all and the storage room was amazing. Nothing inside got wet either. The price is really great too. I 100% recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha

customer_reviews.title: Oustanding merchandise
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this item. Upon unboxing and inspecting the item, it became very cleared of well made it is. Outstanding quality, and the pack itself has many useful pouches. I am impressed not just with the quality of the item, but of the customer care offered by the seller. Thank you for such a speedy delivery, and well made merchandise. I am looking forward in doing business with your company again in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Axel Cardona

customer_reviews.title: Leaking two years later.. Enough said.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Oct 2018. Now leaking May 2020. Where the hose connects to the bag. High Sierra brand bag 2L is still working 10 years later. Would not trust this brand for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: TStix

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hydration pack. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this thing. I picked it up to run obstacle courses like Tough Mudder and Spartan and it performed beautifully. I did a 14 mile Spartan in the rain and mud and this thing worked out perfectly. Had enough room to keep some protein bars plus more if I needed it. Stayed together, stayed balanced. I cleaned it (it was PACKED with mud) and am still using it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Q

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Holds a great deal of water and love the storage area! I ran a several miles already with it and have not had any issues!
customer_reviews.author: E

product_meta.title: Unigear Tactical Hydration Pack Backpack 900D with 2.5L Bladder for Hiking, Biking, Running, Walking and Climbing
feature_bullets: Adjustable shoulder/chest straps. Fit chest sizes from teenagers/kids with 27" up to adults (men and women) with 50" chest size. The chest straps make sure it doesn't bounce when you move; Whistle buckle for emergency.
Rugged 900 Denier Polyester heavy-duty construction with PVC lining, resistant to tears and abrasion; Hands-free hydration hose with bite valve, gently biting the valve opens up the flow of water

REPLACEABLE 2.5L BLADDER: Includes a 2.5 Liter BPA free bladder which keeps you hydrated. It also keeps the water fairly cool. And include a wide screw cap so you can add ice cubes for an even cooler drink. Enough to get you through a day of hiking, cycling, running or biking.
Sleek and compact design: 19" x 10" x 1.5" in size and 22 ounces in weight; Two front pockets for carry your wallet, keys, phone, towel, smalltool, perfect for hiking, running, biking, walking.

60 Day 100% Satisfaction Guarantee:If for any reason you are not 100% satisfied with this product, please contact customer service within 60 days, and we will immediately refund your purchase price - no questions asked
